title: Can we use Spdlog's fmt::format?
body:
I could #define SPDLOG_FMT_EXTERNAL and use my own copy of the fmt library. But, 
would like to use Spdlog's bundled fmt::format - on clang/macos - I get unresolved symbols when building in release mode, linking is fine in debug mode. Any ideas?
```
Undefined symbols for architecture x86_64:
 "std::__1::basic_string<char, std::__1::char_traits<char>, std::__1::allocator<char> > fmt::v6::internal::grouping_impl<char>(fmt::v6::internal::locale_ref)", referenced from:
      fmt::v6::internal::basic_writer<fmt::v6::buffer_range<char> >::int_writer<int, fmt::v6::basic_format_specs<char> >::on_num() in test_logger.cc.o
      fmt::v6::internal::basic_writer<fmt::v6::buffer_range<char> >::int_writer<unsigned int, fmt::v6::basic_format_specs<char> >::on_num() in test_logger.cc.o
      fmt::v6::internal::basic_writer<fmt::v6::buffer_range<char> >::int_writer<long long, fmt::v6::basic_format_specs<char> >::on_num() in test_logger.cc.o
      fmt::v6::internal::basic_writer<fmt::v6::buffer_range<char> >::int_writer<unsigned long long, fmt::v6::basic_format_specs<char> >::on_num() in test_logger.cc.o
      fmt::v6::internal::basic_writer<fmt::v6::buffer_range<char> >::int_writer<__int128, fmt::v6::basic_format_specs<char> >::on_num() in test_logger.cc.o
      fmt::v6::internal::basic_writer<fmt::v6::buffer_range<char> >::int_writer<unsigned __int128, fmt::v6::basic_format_specs<char> >::on_num() in test_logger.cc.o
      fmt::v6::internal::basic_writer<fmt::v6::buffer_range<char> >::int_writer<char, fmt::v6::basic_format_specs<char> >::on_num() in test_logger.cc.o
      ...
```
